title: SDL
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Simple DirectMedia Layer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_DirectMedia_Layer "wikipedia:Simple DirectMedia Layer")***

[![RogueBasin](/images/thumb/d/d9/RogueBasin_logo.png/50px-RogueBasin_logo.png)](/wiki/File:RogueBasin_logo.png "RogueBasin")

[RogueBasin](/wiki/RogueBasin "RogueBasin") has a wiki page about:

***[SDL](https://roguebasin.com?title=Special:Search/SDL)***

The *Simple DirectMedia Layer*, commonly **SDL**, is a library of the [C language](/wiki/ANSI_C "ANSI C") that provides low-level, cross-platform access to audio and video hardware and input devices. The same SDL user interface can compile and run on at least [Mac OS X](/wiki/Mac_OS_X "Mac OS X"), [Microsoft Windows](/wiki/Microsoft_Windows "Microsoft Windows") and [X11](/wiki/X11 "X11"). An SDL user interface will display either full screen, or in a single window.

SDL provides neither interface controls (as buttons and menus), nor fonts and text, nor audio encodings (as Ogg Vorbis), nor image encodings (as PNG). However, other libraries atop or along SDL can provide these things.

[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") already has multiple interfaces for different platforms, but SDL is the basis of both the [glHack](/wiki/GlHack "GlHack") and [Vulture's](/wiki/Vulture%27s "Vulture's") interfaces.

***

The remainder of this page concerns the **SDL** interface to [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). This is a port of the [glHack](/wiki/GlHack "GlHack") interface, and resides in the `win/gl` directory of the SLASH'EM source code. At least one operating system provides a "slashem-sdl" package containing this interface.

## Features

The SDL interface can display the map as text or [tiles](/wiki/Tiles "Tiles"), and can allegedly load the same isometric tiles as the Gtk+ interface. Optionally, the SDL interface may use OpenGL to display the tiles; this compile-time option creates the *GL* interface.

Except for the map, the SDL interface resembles the [tty](/wiki/Tty "Tty") interface. [Messages](/wiki/Message "Message") appear at top, status appears in text at bottom (though in three lines instead of two), and menus appear in text format, without scroll bars or separate windows.

The SDL interface employs its own bitmap fonts to draw text, and the fonts provide full support for [IBMgraphics](/wiki/IBMgraphics "IBMgraphics").

## Requirements

To build the SDL interface, you need the following:

- the SDL library
- the [PNG library](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/libpng "wikipedia:libpng"), to load the tiles
- [GNU](/wiki/GNU "GNU") make

If you enable OpenGL, then you also need the GL library.

The Makefile rules for this interface use a "%" syntax understood by GNU make, but not [BSD](/wiki/BSD "BSD") make. [Bug 1870830](https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail\&aid=1870830\&group_id=9746\&atid=309746) mentions this.

## Controls

Most of the controls and options for the SDL interface remain undocumented. One can put "GLOPTIONS" lines in the [nethackrc](/wiki/Nethackrc "Nethackrc") but no document explains the options. However, the basic controls seem to be \[PageUp] and \[PageDown] to zoom the tiles, and \[End] to toggle between tiles and text.
